chain_of_thought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is a 51-year-old woman with DRESS syndrome precipitated by IV vancomycin and minocycline. Liver function tests show peak ALT of 474 units/L on day 6, peak AST of 474 units/L on day 6, ALP of 114 units/L on day 10, GGT not mentioned, total bilirubin of 0.2 mg/dL on admission (no peak reported), INR of 1 (normal), albumin not mentioned. The clinical outcome is improved/discharged as the patient's symptoms resolved with corticosteroid therapy and liver enzymes normalized at follow-up.
